etymology.description: 精(精) (jīng, "refined") + 制(製) (zhì, "to make") + 品(品) (pǐn, "product") refers to products that have undergone a refining or manufacturing process to enhance their quality or value.
etymology.interpretation: The term 精制品(精製品) (jīngzhìpǐn, "refined products") signifies products that have been carefully processed or manufactured to achieve a high level of refinement or quality, emphasizing meticulous craftsmanship or production methods.
etymology.simplification: Simplified characters used in mainland China.

parts.english: to make; to produce; system; to manufacture

examples.chinese: 他的店铺出售各种精制品(他的店鋪出售各種精製品)。
examples.pinyin: tā de diànpù chūshòu gè zhǒng jīngzhìpǐn.
examples.english: His shop sells various refined products.

examples.chinese: 工厂生产精制品(工廠生產精製品)，出口到世界各地(出口到世界各地)。
examples.pinyin: gōngchǎng shēngchǎn jīngzhìpǐn, chūkǒu dào shìjiè gèdì.
examples.english: The factory manufactures refined products, and exports them to various parts of the world.

examples.chinese: 我们购买只选用最好的精制品(我們購買只選用最好的精製品)。
examples.pinyin: wǒmen gòumǎi zhǐ xuǎnyòng zuì hǎo de jīngzhìpǐn.
examples.english: We only purchase the best refined products.
